body_html: Yes, the problem is that x.size() only contains the overall size, but not the indices and values sizes. If you look at the c code, it just assumes dimensionV = 0 when only given a size.
body_text: Yes, the problem is that x.size() only contains the overall size, but not the indices and values sizes. If you look at the c code, it just assumes dimensionV = 0 when only given a size.
body: Yes, the problem is that `x.size()` only contains the overall size, but not the indices and values sizes. If you look at the c code, it just assumes `dimensionV = 0` when only given a size.
